intro: Pilosella piloselloides subsp. piloselloides, commonly known as the slender goat's beard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered with fine hairs. This subspecies is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed or marginal soils.
